channel.title: Question About Putting A Webclient on my website
channel.description:
Hey, i have a website, and i want to put a webclient on it. i have it all set up and everythign, all i need to to (i think) is make the server a .jar file. on my webpage, the code to put in the webclient looks like this: [code] Java is not installed on your machine or your browser does not allowed Java Applet to run

Get the latest Java technology at http://www.java.com/ [/code] ok i got that, but what do i have to do to the client? do i have to put it into my webste files? do i have to make it a jar file? how do i make it a jar file if i have to?

item.title: Question About Putting A Webclient on my website

@teh_codex wrote:

item.title: Question About Putting A Webclient on my website
item.dc:creator: @Scarecrows Scarecrows
item.description:
@Scarecrows wrote:

You need to rewrite the method that loads the cache to load from a different location or download and automatically extract on to someones computer. You also need to change the directories of the sprites or let them load from the cache. Then you just need to jar + sign the client, upload it to your webhost and implement a HTML applet code on to your web page with the code you provided in your post.

Read full topic
item.source: Question About Putting A Webclient on my website

item.title: Question About Putting A Webclient on my website
item.dc:creator: @Pancakes Pancakes
item.description:
@Pancakes wrote:

Hey, i have a website, and i want to put a webclient on it. i have it all set up and everythign, all i need to to (i think) is make the server a .jar file. on my webpage, the code to put in the webclient looks like this:

<applet code="client.class" archive="Pancakespk.jar" width="766px" height="503px"> <param name="boxmessage" value="Loading SSS" /> Java is not installed on your machine or your browser does not allowed Java Applet to run<br /><br />Get the latest Java technology at <a href="http://www.java.com/">http://www.java.com/</a>

ok i got that, but what do i have to do to the client? do i have to put it into my webste files? do i have to make it a jar file? how do i make it a jar file if i have to?

Read full topic
